actor_awards.notes: He is the only actor to win three Best Supporting Actor Academy Awards.

filmography.title: The Wedding Night
filmography.role_description: A minor but memorable role as a cabbie that impressed producer Sam Goldwyn enough to sign Brennan to a long-term contract.
filmography.plot: A financially strapped novelist moves to his family's Connecticut farm and falls in love with a Polish neighbor.

filmography.title: Barbary Coast
filmography.role_description: An eyepatch-wearing, eccentric old timer who befriends a young prospector in 1850s San Francisco.
filmography.plot: A woman arrives in San Francisco during the Gold Rush to marry a rich miner, only to find he has been murdered.

filmography.title: Fury
filmography.role_description: A rural deputy sheriff who plays a key role in the mob violence against an innocent man.
filmography.plot: An innocent traveler is arrested for kidnapping and seemingly burned to death by a lynch mob, but he survives and seeks revenge.

filmography.title: Come and Get It
filmography.role_description: A loyal Swedish lumberjack who marries the woman his boss loved and lost, earning Brennan the first-ever Best Supporting Actor Oscar.
filmography.plot: A ruthless lumber tycoon abandons a saloon singer for a socialite, only to later fall for his former lover's daughter.

filmography.title: Banjo on My Knee
filmography.role_description: An eccentric riverboat musician and father figure who helps navigate the troubles of a young couple.
filmography.plot: A young man flees on his wedding night after a brawl, leaving his bride behind, while his father tries to reunite them.

filmography.title: Three Godfathers
filmography.role_description: One of three outlaws who sacrifice their freedom and lives to save a baby they find in the desert.
filmography.plot: Three bandits robbing a bank stumble upon a dying mother and her newborn baby in the desert.

filmography.title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
filmography.role_description: The wrongly accused town drunk who is saved from execution by Tom Sawyer's testimony.
filmography.plot: Tom Sawyer and Huckleberry Finn witness a murder in a graveyard and must decide whether to reveal the truth.

filmography.title: Kentucky
filmography.role_description: A cantankerous, horse-loving southern gentleman involved in a family feud, earning Brennan his second Oscar.
filmography.plot: Two lovers from feuding families are brought together by their shared love of horse racing.

filmography.title: Northwest Passage
filmography.role_description: A grumbling, loyal ranger who accompanies Major Rogers on a dangerous expedition during the French and Indian War.
filmography.plot: Major Robert Rogers leads a group of rangers on a perilous mission to destroy an Indian village in Canada.

filmography.title: The Westerner
filmography.role_description: The corrupt, self-appointed 'law west of the Pecos' who develops a complex friendship with a drifter; considered his finest role.
filmography.plot: A drifter is brought before the hanging judge Roy Bean, but talks his way out of it by claiming to know the judge's idol, Lillie Langtry.

filmography.title: Meet John Doe
filmography.role_description: A cynical, harmonica-playing tramp who warns the protagonist against the dangers of wealth and 'heelots'.
filmography.plot: A reporter fabricates a letter from a suicidal 'John Doe' to save her job, sparking a national political movement.

filmography.title: Sergeant York
filmography.role_description: The wise and gentle country preacher who guides Alvin York through his spiritual and moral crisis about war.
filmography.plot: A hillbilly sharpshooter becomes a war hero during World War I despite his religious pacifism.

filmography.title: Swamp Water
filmography.role_description: A fugitive falsely accused of murder who hides out in the dangerous Okefenokee Swamp.
filmography.plot: A trapper discovers a fugitive hiding in the swamp and tries to prove the man's innocence.

filmography.title: The Pride of the Yankees
filmography.role_description: The loyal sportswriter friend to Lou Gehrig who supports him throughout his legendary baseball career.
filmography.plot: The story of the life and career of baseball legend Lou Gehrig, who faces a tragic illness.

filmography.title: Hangmen Also Die!
filmography.role_description: A brave Czech professor and resistance supporter taken hostage by the Nazis after the assassination of Heydrich.
filmography.plot: The assassin of a high-ranking Nazi official hides with a young woman's family while the Gestapo takes hostages.

filmography.title: To Have and Have Not
filmography.role_description: A loyal, alcoholic 'rummy' who constantly asks, 'Was you ever bit by a dead bee?', serving as the skipper's sidekick.
filmography.plot: An expatriate American fisherman in Martinique gets involved with the French Resistance and a sultry drifter.

filmography.title: The Princess and the Pirate
filmography.role_description: A dim-witted, stuttering pirate who tries to protect a princess in this Bob Hope comedy.
filmography.plot: A cowardly actor on the run disguises himself as a pirate and tries to save a princess from the notorious Captain Hook.

filmography.title: My Darling Clementine
filmography.role_description: The vicious, whip-wielding patriarch of the Clanton clan who serves as the ruthless antagonist to Wyatt Earp.
filmography.plot: Wyatt Earp and his brothers arrive in Tombstone and become involved in a deadly feud with the Clanton family.

filmography.title: Red River
filmography.role_description: The cantankerous but loyal cook and trail hand who narrates the epic cattle drive and serves as the conscience of the group.
filmography.plot: A tyrannical rancher drives a cattle herd to Missouri, clashing with his adopted son along the way.

filmography.title: Blood on the Moon
filmography.role_description: A grieving father and settler who stands up against a corrupt agent trying to swindle his neighbors.
filmography.plot: A drifter gets caught up in a conflict between cattlemen and homesteaders, switching sides to fight corruption.

filmography.title: Task Force
filmography.role_description: A senior naval officer who mentors Gary Cooper's character through the evolution of naval aviation.
filmography.plot: The history of US naval aviation is told through the career of a dedicated officer who fights for the importance of aircraft carriers.

filmography.title: The Far Country
filmography.role_description: The cheerful, loyal partner to a selfish cattleman who meets a tragic end during the Gold Rush.
filmography.plot: A self-minded adventurer locks horns with a crooked lawman while driving cattle to the Klondike.

filmography.title: Bad Day at Black Rock
filmography.role_description: A cynical, alcoholic town doctor who decides to help a stranger uncover a dark secret in a hostile town.
filmography.plot: A one-armed stranger arrives in a tiny town with a terrible secret that the locals will kill to keep hidden.

filmography.title: At Gunpoint
filmography.role_description: The town doctor who stands by a shopkeeper after he accidentally kills an outlaw and is abandoned by the fearful townsfolk.
filmography.plot: A peace-loving store owner becomes a hero for killing a bank robber, but the town turns on him when the gang seeks revenge.

filmography.title: Good-bye, My Lady
filmography.role_description: An illiterate, swamp-dwelling uncle who raises an orphan boy and teaches him life lessons through the training of a rare dog.
filmography.plot: An old man and a young boy living in the Mississippi swamps find a rare Basenji dog that changes their lives.

filmography.title: Rio Bravo
filmography.role_description: A gimpy, cantankerous old deputy who guards the jailhouse with a shotgun and provides comic relief and loyalty.
filmography.plot: A small-town sheriff enlists the help of a cripple, a drunk, and a young gunfighter to hold off a rancher's gang.

filmography.title: How the West Was Won
filmography.role_description: A treacherous river pirate who lures settlers into a cave to rob and murder them.
filmography.plot: A family saga covering several decades of Westward expansion in the 19th century, including the Gold Rush and the Civil War.

filmography.title: The One and Only, Genuine, Original Family Band
filmography.role_description: A stubborn, politically active grandfather who leads his musical family into the Dakota Territory during the 1888 election.
filmography.plot: A musical family moves to the Dakota Territory and gets involved in the presidential election between Cleveland and Harrison.

filmography.title: Support Your Local Sheriff!
filmography.role_description: The dim-witted patriarch of a criminal family who is baffled by the town's new, unconventional sheriff.
filmography.plot: A stranger becomes the sheriff of a lawless town and uses his wits to tame the unruly Danby family.
